column4: What would cause "sudo ifconfig eth0 down" to execute without errors, but not bring the interface down?
rootkit   bug   warpper script   kernel bug   ???
oh   and    sudo error    to test that one   do    sudo echo boo     if it says boo it's not sudo
oh   and    sudo error    to test that one   do    sudo echo boo     if it says boo it's not sudo
would you care to test sudo for us.     sudo echo boo
why wouldn't sudo be able to use echo... I did say it returned "boo"
sorry i didn't see your first post of "it returns boo".   ok. that rules out it being sudo.   you did    ifconfig      just to see that the eth0 is still up ?
yea... I brought down the two vmware interfaces and that worked fine... eth0 still hanging on strong though
check the process table to see what might be running interfearance there ?    i'm like you.  that's a new can of verms,  very interested in what is causing it...
hmmm   samba ?       i'm trying to think of anything that might possably hi-jack a network interface...
i'll second the band wagon, i'm no troll either.
so does that mean you're really an agent? :)
heh.  yeah and a creationest.  which is what i was refering to.
